website_summaries.verdict: The lightweight but sturdy telescoping aluminum handles provide versatility. Users can choose between a standard 27 inches in length, or an impressive 39 1/2-inch reach without sacrificing cutting power.
pros: Carbon steel blade, with sharpening kit available
Cuts limbs up to 1 3/4 inches in diameter

customer_reviews.title: Great product ever
customer_reviews.text: Great product ever, it has everything I could want in ratcheting extendable tool. First off, it cuts very thick brunches, i think up to 2", and it cuts like a butter, second it is such a breeze and ease of cutting with no any struggles, and thirdly which is the best part i that it is extendable for ease of storage and carrying. Additionally the fact that it is extendable doesn't reduce the power and quality of cutting in fact it might actually adds to cutting by adding the torque. Simply put, it is just the best product ever, don't look for anything else, this is it, you found it.
customer_reviews.author: eugin

customer_reviews.title: The handles bent over time.
customer_reviews.text: I do like this lopper a lot until the handles started to bend. Two years of usage later, it's been impossible to use it because there is no room for my hands which were pressed in each time i cut a branch. And my hands hurted badly. I had to stop using it for the last 2 years. The spec "sturdy aluminum" is misleading. I'm quite disappointed about this.
customer_reviews.author: KWells

customer_reviews.title: Great item
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my father to use and they are so good, he's going to get himself another pair. The first ratchet brings the jaws of the very sharp blade to the sides of the branch, then the second cuts through whatever you're cutting like butter. I tried them myself and was astonished by how easy it was. We cut branches up to 2.5" easily. The telescoping arms also give you a good four foot reach and lock nicely. Well designed, easy to use, relativley light-weight, these are great. I would definitely recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: T. Csorba

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use but use them correctly like a racheting lopper, not the cheaper kind.  So cool to use.
customer_reviews.text: These are racheting loppers which is how you are supposed to use them. For a small branch like 1/4 or 1/2 inch then just don't open the loppers wide and they work fine. When you have a thick branch and try to use them like the non racheting loppers it won't work. Why would you not take advantage of the racheting feature that makes it super easy. The only reason I can think is that some people out of habit try to use them like a non racheting lopper and these aren't those. Why struggle when you can rachet through the thick branches with ease. I love mine.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not solid steel
customer_reviews.text: If you are used to heavy duty tools made out of solid steel construction, this lopper is not made like that. The handles are like strong plastic material. The good thing is that they won't rust. The bad thing is it gives you a not so great feeling when they bend trying to do large branches. They work, but I wouldn't go cutting anything more than 1 1/2" in thickness.
customer_reviews.author: TechBoomer

customer_reviews.title: Poorly Made. NOT HEAVY DUTY AS DESCRIBED.
customer_reviews.text: A tool for light weight work. Very disappointed. Bought it for the extended handles. They started warping after about 3 dozen cuts on branches no more than 1/2 inch in diameter. Poorly made and cheap. DO NOT BUY unless your are cutting pencils.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Cre8ive

customer_reviews.title: Nice and Easy
customer_reviews.text: I've had my own landscape business for 36 years/ been in the industry for 46 years and love what I do so I have no plans for stopping but now that I'm getting older I more and more appreciate tools that make my work easier. There are days when I do nothing but prune hedges and trees all day and I have a helper who cleans up. A lot of the smaller branches get processed into kindling sized pieces for client use in their fireplaces and these loppers are gonna make the job easier because less muscle power is needed over the long run.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Easy Cut Ratcheting Lopper
customer_reviews.text: Well made, work great. I like to prune our mulberry trees and citrus trees myself. I have a tree service company do the larger trees. I'm getting up there in age (74) and I don't have the straight I used to have. These loppers are great! I'm cutting 1 1/2" branches with no problem. They are sharp and work on smaller branches too. I recommend these to anyone who likes to prune their own trees and shrubs.
customer_reviews.author: Peter in CA

customer_reviews.title: I really liked the product
customer_reviews.text: I really liked the product, but one of the handles bent on me. I have sent that one back and ordered another one. I'm a 56 year old with heart problems and was working on a branch that was above my head. I had the tool fully extended and it bent one side. I'm going to give this product another chance. I think a half inch branch is pushing it fully extended.
customer_reviews.author: Allen

customer_reviews.title: Okay, l received delivery in two days! Unpacked ...
customer_reviews.text: Okay, l received delivery in two days! Unpacked Loppers, read the directions and went to work pruning two lumquact trees. The extension gave me the much needed reach into the trees and the ratcheting action made it a breeze! Just know, when using fully extended, slowly allow the ratcheting mechanism to cut the branch, you don't need to apply undo pressure on the extended handles. It is effortless!!! I truly hope these are long lasting for I saved $$$ not having to hire a tree pruner.
customer_reviews.author: John Barnes

customer_reviews.title: I don't like these loppers - heavy & dull
customer_reviews.text: I don't like these loppers - they have a very large, heavy, head and its hard for me to hold them up to cut branches but the worst part is that they don't cut very well. Also, its hard to get the ratchet action to engage. I've been using Fiskars loppers for about 30 years and thought to give MLTools a try based on Amazon reviews - I regret that decision. Fiskars are lighter, cut a LOT better, and they're cheaper.
customer_reviews.author: Goldie

customer_reviews.title: My new favorite!!😎
customer_reviews.text: I have had ratchet cutters previously. This one surpasses all the others I own! Very sharp, l I am impressed with the sharpness and light weight of this ratchet cutter! I own several long handle ratchet cutters! This one surpasses all the others. .I'm over 70's, and was concerned with the weight! No problem
customer_reviews.author: cioc Christine

customer_reviews.title: Broke locking nut
customer_reviews.text: REVISED review. One of the plastic locking nuts located at the end of one of the handles apparently was stripped by over tightening during manufacturing. The handle now cannot lock itself into any of its various positions. Message sent to seller; will change review pending response. SECOND Revision: ML Tools responded promptly to the problem and replaced the lopper, which now works as expected. Rating upgraded.
customer_reviews.author: QuantumFog

customer_reviews.title: Better than I expected
customer_reviews.text: It doesn't take long to get used to how the ratcheting system works. Cutting through 1 1/2 inch branches was MUCH easier compared to non-ratcheting loppers. Only minimal effort was needed to cut smaller branches. My back appreciated the handle extensions as I didn't need to bend over as much snipping branches on the ground down to size. I wouldn't say it is light, but it is not too heavy to use throughout the day. Overall, I'm very happy with quality and operation of these loppers.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Chin

customer_reviews.title: I love this tool, most buyers should enjoy, no weak point found.
customer_reviews.text: Already several months in use. Very well designed ratcheting action combined with telescoping handles makes them both very powerful and also convenient in close quarters. I was cutting heavy palm leaves and mulberry branches as thick as I could grab with fully open blades. Slicing effortlessly through wood and no signs of fatigue on the tool. I was pruning my two palm trees three mulberry trees and two peach trees. Before reaching for the saw I was testing this heavy duty cutter to full extent. And for those getting confused easily - to extent handles turn end knobs about 90 deg, one clockwise and the other anticlockwise.
customer_reviews.author: Z. Bobinski

customer_reviews.title: Long handles and ratchet mechanism make limb lopping easy.
customer_reviews.text: Makes brush & tree trimming easy. The length of the handles affords reaching into bush interior much easier, plus the wide jaw opening and ratchet mechanism make cutting fairly large branches easy. One caution, keep in mind that the handles are aluminum. I did manage to take excess advantage of its cutting power and have bent one of the handles slightly.
customer_reviews.author: Bilgewater

customer_reviews.title: Great pair of shears
customer_reviews.text: I bought these as a replacement for my old hickory-handled loping shears and I am very impressed with them. The ratcheting action makes cutting even the larger branches and brush so much easier. The extendable handles make reaching further so much easier than climbing or stretching. The only concern I have is how flexible the handles feel when extended, but they seem to do fine.
customer_reviews.author: Ken H.

customer_reviews.title: Nice lightweight pruner
customer_reviews.text: These have worked well for almost a year. They do cut through good sized branches and have made trimming the neglected yard of a recently purchased home much easier. They are lightweight enough to use for a couple hours and fairly strong. I have used stronger ones but for the weight and price these are great!.. They have held up and are still as good as the day I received them.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Martin

customer_reviews.title: Good idea, bad design
customer_reviews.text: Took it out of the Box And went outside and cut one branch. And the handles have a bow. That's with ONE (1) branch just to test out my new tool. It is lightweight and easy to use but I can only imagine what it would look like after I used it more. So glad I didn't destroy the box.
customer_reviews.author: Nobody

customer_reviews.title: Excellent lopper
customer_reviews.text: This tool is the best lopper that I have ever owned. The ratchet works well. As the instructions say, one should open the handles only one click and then cut again, repeating that process until the limb is cut through. For small stuff, the ratchet is not necessary and the tool works well as a normal lopper.
customer_reviews.author: RW

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, functional loppers
customer_reviews.text: I have used it once so far, but it went through thick branches ( between 0.5 - 1 ") easily. It is easy to use and does not have to be opened up really wide in order to cut a larger branch. That is why I wanted to get a new one because the one I had prior needed to be opened up close to 180 ̊ in order to cut a larger branch.
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: Quality, light weight loppers
customer_reviews.text: Seem well made and the extension feature works great - you only have to twist the handle end caps to adjust - instead of the entire handle with most extendable loppers. I rated it a 4 because I am concerned about the strength of the aluminum handles on large cuts - they claim a 1 3/4" cutting capacity - but I would not try that on hardwoods like oak. Although the aluminum handles make them lighter than extendable loppers of all steel construction, there is noticeable bending on very large cuts. It's really not an issue with me however, as I seldom cut anything over 1".
customer_reviews.author: WC DuMond

customer_reviews.title: Very sharp. Not a true ratchet.
customer_reviews.text: Very sharp and cuts branches easily. The tool is not a ratchet like a PVC pipe cutter ratchet, which is what I was looking for. Very sturdy until you extend the handles, the extension feels very flimsy so I stopped using it extended.
customer_reviews.author: Vernie N. Ramkissoon

customer_reviews.title: My Own Lopper
customer_reviews.text: I love this style of lopper. I bought this one so I could stop "borrowing" my wife's identical lopper. Whenever she needed the lopper, I often had used it and left it somewhere else. Now we each have our own - along with mini-loppers & pruning shears....
customer_reviews.author: Bill A.

customer_reviews.title: Great Ratcheting Loppers
customer_reviews.text: I bought these loppers because of the ratcheting feature and the fact that the handles were extendable. The other lopper I had took too much strength to cut some limbs. While my husband didn't have a problem using the old loppers, I wanted something easier to use. I was able to extend the handles when under a palm with 3 inch thorns to cut thick fronds with the ratcheting action. At 62, I no longer have the strength I had at 30 and these loppers made a huge difference and let me trim what was needed.
customer_reviews.author: Lily

customer_reviews.title: Dulls fast
customer_reviews.text: Started out great but after 2 days of use the blades became so dull it doesn't cut anything now.
customer_reviews.author: Trigger HappyTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: OK
customer_reviews.text: I like the ratcheting feature. Just started using them. They make a clean cut. I have some concern about durability of the handles when they are extended. Be sure to keep the handles aligned and not twisted when making a cut.
customer_reviews.author: Bobwhite

customer_reviews.title: Very light yet very sturdy.
customer_reviews.text: I used my now favorite pruners today, to prune 3 rose of sharons shrubs I didn't get to in May because of the wettest May in northern California history. They were flopping all over. I'm 5'2" and I could reach every branch I wanted! I highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Pat Lauffer

customer_reviews.title: Great quality tool for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my elderly father. Light weight. Ratcheting action makes using a breeze. Have recommended these to many people.
customer_reviews.author: Jelly Bean

customer_reviews.title: The handles bend noticeably when cutting a hard branch
customer_reviews.text: The handles bend noticeably when cutting a hard branch and when a branch is cut through the flex of the handles lets your two hands collide painfully. Otherwise it is good for smaller or softer branches.
customer_reviews.author: William J. Dunaj

customer_reviews.title: Works great. Handles sizable branches with ease
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Handles sizable branches with ease. Light but heavy duty construction. The only drawback is that the handle extension mechanism is operated on the end of the handles. You twist the end cap to extend or contract. Not the best design because when you are working you can accidentally twist this cap.
customer_reviews.author: C. Grant

customer_reviews.title: Good tool overall
customer_reviews.text: The racheting mxn seems to work well and helps to cut through thicker branches. The mechanism to extend the handles also works well. I never cut while I had the handles extended but based on the force required to cut a 1" branch, I share the concerns of others that the handles might bend (and thus not 5 stars).
customer_reviews.author: J. Gossage

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: They pass through large branches easily. But really big branches you can feel them give a bit. They would break if i power through. So after the first few clicks i turn it and do the finishing cut.
customer_reviews.author: P Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty except when fully extended
customer_reviews.text: These work really well, unless you're using the handles fully extended and trying to cut a branch over your head. The handles will bow and feel shaky/weak. It made me a bit nervous when they were fully extended, but otherwise they work very well, even for giant tumbleweeds on the ground! The ratcheting action works very well and saves you from using much 'elbow grease' when removing branches. The colors are nice and it looks appealing and feels pretty sturdy (except when working on thicker branches at full extension).
customer_reviews.author: M. C. PayetteTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Best buy
customer_reviews.text: Very inexpensive. Very usable. I cut 1 1/2 inch branches with ease. The ratcheting feature was almost miraculous. The extending handles let me reach more branches without moving the ladder. It was a little heavy but the pruning was much faster. Two day delivery was appreciated. This was a best buy.
customer_reviews.author: ok1wire

customer_reviews.title: Great product for a good price.
customer_reviews.text: These are amazing! The jaws are very wide & ratcheting action is smooth. I am a professional gardener who frequently does light to medium duty pruning, and these are my go-to now!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Too heavy
customer_reviews.text: I bought this lopper to cut down some cattails in the lake behind our house. I specifically chose this one as it extended the most so I could reach the cattails a little further away from the edge of the lake. Unfortunately, while it is a sturdy and attractive looking tool, it is way too heavy for me to use for any extended period of time (5ft 3 woman). After a few minutes of use, my arms were about to fall off! Wish I could return it :(
customer_reviews.author: adrienne547

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: I love these. I have almost trimmed every tree in my yard. They are easy to use once you figure out how to use them properly.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy Williams

customer_reviews.title: Cuts when a regular looper won’t
customer_reviews.text: If you haven’t tried a ratcheting looper, and have trouble cutting thicker branches with a regular looper, you’ve got to try this product. It works really well. I was helping a neighbor cut down a tree and this product helped tremendously with the smaller branches. My neighbor liked it so much she said she was going to purchase one.
customer_reviews.author: William S.

customer_reviews.title: This thing works great!
customer_reviews.text: Wow! I’ve been able to cut 2” diameter branches with this tool. And without a lot of effort on my part. This thing is worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: William J Fasel

customer_reviews.title: Does the job but bends a lot
customer_reviews.text: These work, but with the handles extended, there is a lot of bend in them. I can see them possibly becoming misshapen over time.
customer_reviews.author: Vona

customer_reviews.title: need muscle to extend handles
customer_reviews.text: very hard to extend handles, easy to use and makes a nice clean cut
customer_reviews.author: Ron

customer_reviews.title: Good performance for a simple tool, very essential in gardening tasks
customer_reviews.text: Amazon delivers again and again building trust among the buying public. MLTOOLS product is excellent in all respects. Used it yesterday for the first time and there was NO mechanical failures or manufacturing defects. Good product and highly recommended. Thank you ML Tools Cust Serv Team for the professional follow up on the purchase, Well done
customer_reviews.author: Eagledives

customer_reviews.title: Recommended
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for trimming my large date palm fronds. Be sure and read the instructions for using the ratchet system.
customer_reviews.author: Harry Wingfield

customer_reviews.title: 👍👍👍
customer_reviews.text: Great quality. It was exactly what I was looking for. Will purchase and recommend highly to anyone. I use it on giant bird of paradise and palm trees.
customer_reviews.author: RNK

customer_reviews.title: Spot on the $$
customer_reviews.text: Just as shown, VERY WELL MADE and should last for a long time!!! Another great buy through Amazon!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Jerry

customer_reviews.title: This lopper was easy to use and easy to adjust the length of ...
customer_reviews.text: Having used a ratcheting extendable lopper before, I was familiar with the operation. This lopper was easy to use and easy to adjust the length of the handles. Great cutting on hedge limbs. I had no problem with the weight of the lopper. Very nice product at a very reasonable price. I'm a very happy 77 yr. young lady.
customer_reviews.author: Loie

customer_reviews.title: Arms bend when extended
customer_reviews.text: Light and easy to use but when cutting bigger branches with the arms extended, they bent. Then my fingers got pinched. Took the bent one off, turned it around, now the bend provides extra finger clearance. I also do not extend the arms for larger branches.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Williams

customer_reviews.title: Worked great
customer_reviews.text: I love the extending handles. The ratcheting motion was trick to cutting the branches other loppers wouldn't cut.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: excellent tool very sharp and the ratcheting jaws make it ...
customer_reviews.text: excellent tool very sharp and the ratcheting jaws make it work great. Gives me extra reach when trimming trees and heavy shrubs. would recommend to anyone with a lot of trimming to do.
customer_reviews.author: d vestal

customer_reviews.title: Need better cutting blade.
customer_reviews.text: This item has good extendtion but is very heavy and the short hawk bill or curved cutting blade makes it arkward to use.
customer_reviews.author: mubin amin

customer_reviews.title: Great Ratcheting Lopper
customer_reviews.text: I love this ratcheting lopper when the ratchet works and the extending arms helped to reach higher limbs. The ratcheting lopper worked great when the ratchet worked properly. I used it a lot this past weekend and yes I would buy it again. I used this a few more days long hours and the ratcheting looper is working better and better. The best I've owned
customer_reviews.author: Trying

customer_reviews.title: Buy this one!
customer_reviews.text: The pruner is larger than I thought it would be. It is solid, it seems that if the jaws were a little bigger it could down a tree. I am very happy I purchased this pruner. The telescoping handles for more leverage, the ratcheting mechanism all is good.You will not be disappointed. .
customer_reviews.author: Michael P. Quintero

customer_reviews.title: Love these cutters
customer_reviews.text: Love these cutters! They are a little heavier than I had envisioned, but I can still handle them okay, and I like to have sturdy tools. The blades are wonderfully tough and sharp; the ratchet works like a dream and they cut well, as advertised. The extension feature is brilliant--just twist at the bottom of the handle instead of having to yank at them. This is an all-round high-quality product that exceeds my expectations. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: GreenCedar

customer_reviews.title: These are amazing. You can cut branches that you normally need ...
customer_reviews.text: These are amazing. You can cut branches that you normally need a saw for. Every homeowner with a tree or big bushes should have these. This is my second one because the first one was stolen.
customer_reviews.author: Odyssey

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: Snapped after first day of use:(. Will stick with paying a bit more for Fiscars!
customer_reviews.author: nancy L marable

customer_reviews.title: Work GREAT!
customer_reviews.text: Owned one with same ratchet mechanism for many years, knew it is good but wished for longer handles many times. These handle mechanisms seem like they'll last as well, WITH judicious use.
customer_reviews.author: Dwayne Oxford

customer_reviews.title: I really like it so far.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace another ratcheting lopper. I've only had the chance to use this once so far but I really like it. It made a nice clean cut with minimal effort. I prefer the way this extends over the previous one I had. It's a much easier system for extending but will not open or close accidentally. I also received this very soon after I placed the order. All in all a good experience with this company
customer_reviews.author: kimp

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight
customer_reviews.text: Honda. Used it yet, but looks as expected, truth will come with how long it stays sharp and how easy to sharpen as well as the bolts that keep it together working.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Huston

customer_reviews.title: Great Pruners
customer_reviews.text: I've only had them a short time but they work great. I love the ratcheting design. I have arthritis and they are a little heavy but worth the effort. They would be very light weight for most people.
customer_reviews.author: Phyllis Rafferty

customer_reviews.title: Unique High Quality Tool
customer_reviews.text: Light weight but strong. Very sharp; besides thick branches it can cut through even green branches and stems with ease. Don't need an anvil cutter. Opens wide and the hook is a bit serrated so it grabs on. Easy to lengthen and shorten: twist open, pull, twist and lock. Seems quite durable, but I can't speak to its long term life. Haven't yet seen anything to compete and am very happy with purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Len

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use for women, children, men, for all, young and old!
customer_reviews.text: Very user friendly and extremely easy to use. The ratcheting allows pretty much anyone to prune up to about 1 inch branches. Takes every little effort to function. Mush easier to use than regular pruners! I would definitely recommend them and would purchase again!
customer_reviews.author: J.L.L.

customer_reviews.title: Great tool for trees and large plants
customer_reviews.text: This is great. We have used it to cut branches from both small trees (Japanese Maple) and larger trees, and the ratcheting mechanism works really well. My husband has used it as well and thinks it is well made. We originally bought a non ratcheting version from home depot and are so glad we returned it for this one. Worth the extra money!
customer_reviews.author: Alex's Mom

customer_reviews.title: Easy, light weight, nice cut!
customer_reviews.text: Love Love Love! I've always loved my hand ratcheting pruners, and now they have loppers too? Nice! They work great! They make my job easier, and with the extended handles, I'm much more efficient now too.
customer_reviews.author: Jody Gardner

customer_reviews.title: The best clippers I've ever had!
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing tool. I am in my 70's with some arthritis and can use these clippers on 1.5 inch branches without pain or discomfort. It took me a few tries to figure out the mechanism, once learned, this tool cuts wood like butter. Almost. I highly recommend these clippers. A friend already bought this tool and is as pleased with it as I am.
customer_reviews.author: christa

customer_reviews.title: useful for light duty only
customer_reviews.text: Handles bent on first use. I don't know if it's the construction or just aluminum, but one of the handles warped on first use. I am a fairly strong guy, but I bought this to replace fiberglass loppers that lasted me many years, so I was surprised to see the warping so easily.
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: Handles are starting to bend.
customer_reviews.text: Ratchet is excellent but the handles are starting to bend. We may need to weld some supports to it.

customer_reviews.title: It's ok but doesn't seem like the ratchet aspect of the tool is working correctly

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent! When I moved I was not able to bring my favorite racheting looper took (discontinued 10 yrs old!) and worrued I wouldn't find another as good. Well I did, and actually this one's even better. I look pretty strong out there (woman age 64) trimming my own tree with such ease! I highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Mary of Arizona

customer_reviews.title: Great tool!
customer_reviews.text: Just received today but my first impression is I am so glad I got. Cuts great, easy to use & extensions are just right length for me to handle. A great equalizer for senior female without a lot of strength in hands & arms. Tool is strong & powerful,.
customer_reviews.author: BDTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Used this pair to cut up at a local peach ...
customer_reviews.text: Used this pair to cut up at a local peach orchard. While there I tried various other models including the Fiskars varieties and others. If you need to cut anything over 1" this may not be the right pruners.
customer_reviews.author: clubtoe

customer_reviews.title: I really enjoyed how easy they are to use and I'm thinking ...
customer_reviews.text: I decided to try this cutting tool after reading the reviews by others and after a day of pruning a few trees with it, I really enjoyed how easy they are to use and I'm thinking of buying a smaller one for low cutting and maybe a hand held too. And having Prime mark on them helped too.
customer_reviews.author: Doyce Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality, Too Heavy
customer_reviews.text: This is a great tool, except it's too heavy. I have a difficult time holding it up high enough for any length of time to reach some branches without my arms giving in. Granted, I'm not a weight lifter, but I would expect these clippers to be a comfortable weight to use. I need my son to use them for me. I love the extending handles, but this adds to the weight of the tool. Sorry, I would not purchase them again.
customer_reviews.author: B Pottinger

customer_reviews.title: If you need to trim bigger branches and have arthritis in your hands this is the perfect tool!
customer_reviews.text: This makes cutting through branches very easy and the extension is perfect for those of us that are shorter.

customer_reviews.text: This is a great product. It replaced a similar ratchet lopper that I purchased at a county fair and have used for years. When it wore out I look to Lowes and Home Depot to find a ratcheting lopper but they didn't seem to have one. Hence I came across this one on Amazon and love it. Cuts great with minimum effort. customer_reviews.author: Geno A. Spatafore

customer_reviews.title: Really nice
customer_reviews.text: They are great, really like the easy way the handles extend

Size:Easy Cut bypass Lopper
ML GARDEN TOOLS EXTENDABLE RATCHETING LOPPERS L8230 


MLTOOLS L8230 Ratcheting hand Lopper have SK-5 High Carbon Steel blade with unbeatable ratcheting mechanism. Extendable Length can be set at ANY POSITION between 27” and 39-1/2” --- Usable length is 25-1/2” to 37-1/2 (cutting point to the end of handle). They offer 1-3/4 inch diameter cutting capacity. Its ratcheting mechanism lightens your gardening job by at least 5 times comparing with regular loppers. Light-weighted but sturdy aluminum extendable handles with non-slip grips. Now give yourself a chance to try their cutting power, you will find with our ratcheting hand pruners, you save so much time and energy- not just doing pruning but also enjoying your lovely gardens! 



HOW TO USE MLTOOLS RATCHETING PRUNING SHEARS/LOPPERS 

1. Open the pruners / Loppers all the way and place the blades on the subject branch, as far into the jaw as possible. 
2. Squeeze the handles together, advancing the blades through the branch with minimal effort. Once you feel increased handle resistance, STOP squeezing. 
3. Open the handles slowly and slightly until you hear a definite CLICK sound. STOP and do not open the blades any further. (Do not open the blades all the way!) 
4. Now SQUEEZE the handles again, repeating steps 2 and 3 as necessary to finish the cut completely. 

FRIENDLY HINT: Words seem to be complicated. But you really only need some practice. Once you get used to them you will find them amazingly easy to use. Happy pruning!
